meanings.definition: To give a new name to something, especially after it has already been named.
meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to rechristen the class pet 'Sparky' after finding out it was actually a girl.
meanings.sent2: The organization decided to rechristen their annual event to attract more attendees.
meanings.sent3: After the mix-up with the name tags, they had to rechristen everyone with their correct names.
meanings.sent4: The old building was rechristened as a community center after undergoing renovations.
meanings.sent5: The artist chose to rechristen her painting 'Sunset Serenade' to better reflect its calming colors.

meanings.definition: To rename something, especially in a religious or ceremonial context.
meanings.sent1: The priest will rechristen the church bell during the special ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The tradition is to rechristen each new ship before its maiden voyage.
meanings.sent3: In a playful gesture, they decided to rechristen their favorite tree 'Bob'.
meanings.sent4: The ancient relic was rechristened to honor the new archaeological discovery.
meanings.sent5: The king chose to rechristen his sword 'Excalibur' to inspire his knights in battle.
